abstract: There’s no obvious link between an American bank, a British oil driller and a Japanese carmaker. But the reputational struggles of these three global giants suggest one lesson that won’t be lost on shrewd corporations.
snippet: There’s no obvious link between an American bank, a British oil driller and a Japanese carmaker. But the reputational struggles of these three global giants suggest one lesson that won’t be lost on shrewd corporations.
lead_paragraph: The troubles of BP, the British oil giant, have certainly handed Goldman Sachs a public relations reprieve. Similarly, the Wall Street firm’s travails after accusations of fraud took Toyota’s recall problems off the front pages.

headline.main: A Spotlight Big Enough for One Bad Guy at a Time
headline.print_headline: Just One Bad Guy In the Spotlight

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Robert Cyran
